item.title: Life
item.description: Born in Norfolk, Raised Around the World Curiosity My natural intellectual curiosity manifests itself creatively as well as professionally. I take pleasure both in mastering the pursuits I choose and sharing them with others. It is paradoxical that my longest standing passions are those I am unable to enjoy daily, such as dinghy sailing and yachting – each family traditions – and classical guitar playing, which I maintain but rarely have the opportunity to develop further.

item.title: NYT Mask Acceptance
item.description: NYT mask use Github source for data https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/tree/master/mask-use Getting the data #Source for data url <- "https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/raw/master/mask-use/mask-use-by-county.csv" nyt_mask_survey <- read_csv(url) nyt_mask_survey <- nyt_mask_survey %>% clean_names() %>% mutate( mostly_yes= frequently+always, mostly_no = never+rarely, delta = mostly_yes-mostly_no ) glimpse(nyt_mask_survey) ## Rows: 3,142 ## Columns: 9 ## $ countyfp <chr> "01001", "01003", "01005", "01007", "01009", "01011", "010… ## $ never <dbl> 0.053, 0.083, 0.067, 0.020, 0.053, 0.031, 0.102, 0.152, 0.… ## $ rarely <dbl> 0.

item.title: Lincoln
item.description: The Problem The June 2016 Eropean Union (EU) Referendum, which resulted in a United Kingdom’s “Brexit” vote to leave the EU, was a significant turning point in international diplomacy. Understanding the potential drivers behind the United Kingsom’s decision, voting 52% to 48% to leave, is crucial to glean a better picture of what the nation hopes for as it removes formal political ties with the rest of Europe. From a party perspective, analyses into who Brexit voters are allows them to capitalise off underlying motivations to advance their political standing.

item.title: Nightingale
item.description: The Problem Gun control is one of the most hotly debated topics in the United States. There is a deep divide between those who consider it their Second Amendment right to bear arms, and those who believe the widespread posession of firearms is a threat to public health and safety. Here, we conceptualize two dominant risks posed by the widespread acceptance of firearms ownership in modern American society - suicide and homicide.

item.title: Odum
item.description: The Problem Santander Bikes (or “Boris Bikes”, in recognition of the then-Mayor of London Boris Johnson), are widely used across the City of London by tens of thousands of people every day. Understanding how many bikes are likely to be in use on a given day of the week, and a given month of the year is crucial for making decisions around how many bikes to provide, how often they need to be serviced, and make revenue and profitability forecasts crucial for informing future investment in “green” technologies and services in the City of London.

item.title: Rockerfeller
item.description: The Problem Airline carriers receive a high volume of public Tweets daily, which in the most part they need to interact with or address directly both to ensure good customer experience and avoid public humiliation. Tweets vary from positive “thank you” messages to complaints and accusations of “lost luggage”, “delayed flights” and “unfair fees”. Analysing this data in real-time is crucial for Airlines’ customer service teams to address complaints and negative publicity proactively and positively, and make happy passengers feel valued and recognised.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.
